CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF farthest GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            RETURN true  
        ELSE  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET matrix AS a list containing m elements, each being a list of length n filled with 1  
        SET rowIndex TO 1  
        WHILE rowIndex < m DO  
            SET columnIndex TO 1  
            WHILE columnIndex < n DO  
                SET currentRow TO matrix[rowIndex]  
                SET currentRow[columnIndex] TO matrix[rowIndex - 1][columnIndex] + currentRow[columnIndex - 1]  
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET rowIndex TO rowIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN matrix[m - 1][n - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                SET element at position j of element at position i of dp TO the sum of the element at position i MINUS one of dp at position j AND the element at position i of dp at position j MINUS one

        END FOR

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION combine(n, k)
        FUNCTION backtrack(begin, sequence)
            IF NOT (LENGTH(sequence) NOT EQUAL TO k)
                result COLLECT COPY(sequence)
                RETURN
            END IF
            SET index TO begin
            WHILE index < n + 1
                sequence ADD index
                backtrack(index + 1, sequence)
                sequence REMOVE LAST
                index INCREASE BY 1
            END WHILE
        END FUNCTION
        result ASSIGN LIST()
        backtrack(1, LIST())
        RETURN result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION combine WITH PARAMETERS n k  
        FUNCTION backtrack WITH PARAMETERS start path  
            IF the LENGTH OF path EQUALS k  
                APPEND a COPY OF path TO result  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            FOR i FROM start TO n PLUS one  
                APPEND i TO path  
                CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS i PLUS one path  
                REMOVE the LAST ELEMENT FROM path  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
        SET result TO an EMPTY LIST  
        CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS one AN EMPTY LIST  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET is_palindrome TO a two dimensional collection of size n by n filled with FALSE  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET element at position i at position i of is_palindrome TO TRUE  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR length FROM two TO n  
            FOR start FROM zero TO n MINUS length  
                SET end TO start PLUS length MINUS one  
                IF length EQUALS two  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s AND the element at position start PLUS one at position end MINUS one of is_palindrome  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position zero at position i of is_palindrome  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO zero  
            ELSE  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO positive infinity  
                FOR j FROM one TO i  
                    IF element at position j at position i of is_palindrome AND element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one LESS THAN element at position i of min_cuts  
                        SET element at position i of min_cuts TO element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n MINUS one of min_cuts  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        INITIALIZE dp AS a list WITH (n + 1) elements EACH SET TO infinity_value  
        ASSIGN dp[0] ← 0  
        INITIALIZE squares AS an empty list  
        ASSIGN counter ← 1  
        LOOP  
            IF (counter * counter) > n THEN EXIT LOOP  
            ADD (counter * counter) TO squares  
            SET counter ← counter + 1  
        END LOOP  
        ASSIGN index ← 1  
        WHILE index ≤ n DO  
            FOR EACH current_square IN squares DO  
                IF current_square > index THEN  
                    EXIT FOR  
                ELSE  
                    TEMP ← dp[index - current_square] + 1  
                    IF TEMP < dp[index] THEN  
                        SET dp[index] ← TEMP  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        SET dp TO a list of size n PLUS one FILLED WITH infinite value  
        SET the element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        SET squares TO an empty list  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        FOR i FROM one TO n  
            FOR each square IN squares  
                IF i IS LESS THAN square  
                    BREAK the inner loop  
                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)
        DECLARE cache AS an empty map

        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)
            IF NOT (state NOT IN cache) THEN
                RETURN cache[state]
            END IF

            DECLARE iterator AS 0
            WHILE iterator <= LENGTH(state) - 2 DO
                IF (state[iterator] = '+') AND (state[iterator + 1] = '+') THEN
                    DECLARE before_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, 0, iterator)
                    DECLARE after_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, iterator + 2, LENGTH(state))
                    DECLARE candidate_state AS CONCATENATE(before_segment, '--', after_segment)

                    IF FALSE = can_win_helper(candidate_state) THEN
                        ASSIGN TRUE TO cache[state]
                        RETURN TRUE
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN iterator + 1 TO iterator
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN FALSE TO cache[state]
            RETURN FALSE
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN can_win_helper(currentState)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)  
        SET memo TO an empty dictionary  
        
        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)  
            IF state EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN the value associated with state in memo  
            END IF  
            
            FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF state MINUS one MINUS one  
                IF the element at position index of state EQUALS the plus character AND the element at position index PLUS one of state EQUALS the plus character THEN  
                    SET new_state TO the substring from position zero TO position index MINUS one CONCATENATED WITH two minus characters CONCATENATED WITH the substring from position index PLUS two TO the END OF state  
                    IF the result of calling can_win_helper WITH new_state IS EQUAL TO false THEN  
                        SET the value associated with state in memo TO true  
                        RETURN true  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            SET the value associated with state in memo TO false  
            RETURN false  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling can_win_helper WITH currentState  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION isSelfCrossing(distance)
        ASSIGN lengthValue ← SIZE(distance)
        IF NOT (lengthValue ≥ 4) THEN
            RETURN False
        END IF

        SET index ← 3
        WHILE index ≤ lengthValue - 1 DO
            ASSIGN current ← distance[index]
            ASSIGN prev2 ← distance[index - 2]
            ASSIGN prev1 ← distance[index - 1]
            ASSIGN prev3 ← distance[index - 3]

            IF (current ≥ prev2) AND (prev1 ≤ prev3) THEN
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF (index ≥ 4) THEN
                ASSIGN prev3Check ← distance[index - 3]
                ASSIGN prev4Check ← distance[index - 4]
                IF (prev1 = prev3Check) AND ((current + prev4Check) ≥ prev2) THEN
                    RETURN True
                END IF
            END IF

            IF (index ≥ 5) THEN
                ASSIGN prev2Check ← distance[index - 2]
                ASSIGN prev4Check ← distance[index - 4]
                ASSIGN prev3Check ← distance[index - 3]
                ASSIGN prev1Check ← distance[index - 1]
                ASSIGN prev5Check ← distance[index - 5]

                IF (prev2Check ≥ prev4Check) AND (prev3Check ≥ prev1Check) AND ((prev1Check + prev5Check) ≥ prev3Check) AND ((current + prev4Check) ≥ prev2Check) THEN
                    RETURN True
                END IF
            END IF

            INCREMENT index BY 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

        IF n LESS THAN four  
            RETURN False  
        END IF

            IF element at position i of distance GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS two of distance AND element at position i MINUS one of distance LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS three of distance  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            IF i GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO four AND element at position i MINUS one of distance EQUALS element at position i MINUS three of distance AND element at position i PLUS element at position i MINUS four of distance GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS two of distance  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            IF i GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO five AND element at position i MINUS two of distance GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS four of distance AND element at position i MINUS three of distance GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS one of distance AND element at position i MINUS one of distance PLUS element at position i MINUS five of distance GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS three of distance AND element at position i PLUS element at position i MINUS four of distance GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO element at position i MINUS two of distance  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN False  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION integerBreak(n)  
        SET dpList AS an array of zeros sized n PLUS 1  
        SET dpList[1] AS 1  
        SET outerCounter TO 2  
        WHILE outerCounter IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n DO  
            SET currentMax TO 0  
            SET innerCounter TO 1  
            WHILE innerCounter IS LESS THAN outerCounter DO  
                SET firstProduct TO innerCounter TIMES dpList[outerCounter MINUS innerCounter]  
                SET secondProduct TO innerCounter TIMES (outerCounter MINUS innerCounter)  
                SWITCH TRUE  
                    CASE currentMax < firstProduct AND currentMax < secondProduct:  
                        IF firstProduct > secondProduct THEN  
                            SET currentMax TO firstProduct  
                        ELSE  
                            SET currentMax TO secondProduct  
                        END IF  
                    CASE currentMax < firstProduct:  
                        SET currentMax TO firstProduct  
                    CASE currentMax < secondProduct:  
                        SET currentMax TO secondProduct  
                END SWITCH  
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET dpList[outerCounter] TO currentMax  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dpList[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)
        SET length_password AS LENGTH OF password
        SET lower_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS lowercase letter
        SET upper_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS uppercase letter
        SET digit_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS digit

        SET missing_char_types AS 3 MINUS (lower_found PLUS upper_found PLUS digit_found)

        SET replacements_needed TO 0
        SET count_mod0 TO 0
        SET count_mod1 TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 2

        WHILE index_counter < length_password
            IF (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1]) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 2])

                WHILE (index_counter < length_password) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1])
                    SET streak_length TO (streak_length PLUS 1)
                    SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
                END WHILE

                SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed PLUS (streak_length DIV 3)

                IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 0
                    SET count_mod0 TO count_mod0 PLUS 1
                ELSE IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 1
                    SET count_mod1 TO count_mod1 PLUS 1
                END IF
            ELSE
                SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF length_password < 6
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND (6 MINUS length_password)
        ELSE IF length_password <= 20
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        ELSE
            SET excess_length TO length_password MINUS 20

            SET min_del0 AS MINIMUM OF excess_length AND count_mod0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS min_del0

            SET remaining_after_del0 TO MAXIMUM OF (excess_length MINUS min_del0) AND 0
            SET min_del1 AS MINIMUM OF remaining_after_del0 AND (count_mod1 TIMES 2)
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (min_del1 DIV 2)

            SET remaining_after_del1 TO MAXIMUM OF (remaining_after_del0 MINUS min_del1) AND 0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (remaining_after_del1 DIV 3)

            RETURN excess_length PLUS MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        END IF
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION findMinDifference(timePoints)  
        FUNCTION to_minutes(time)

            WHILE pos LESS THAN length of time  
                IF time[pos] EQUALS ":"  
                    EXIT WHILE  
                ELSE  
                    ADD time[pos] TO components  
                    SET pos TO pos + 1  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            SET colon_index TO pos

            SET mins_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM colon_index + 1 TO length of time

        END FUNCTION

        WHILE idx LESS THAN length of timePoints

        END WHILE

        SET shortest_gap TO INFINITY  
        SET pointer TO 1  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of minute_values  
            SET gap TO minute_values[pointer] - minute_values[pointer - 1]  
            IF gap < shortest_gap THEN  
                SET shortest_gap TO gap  
            END IF  
            SET pointer TO pointer + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET wrap_gap TO 1440 - minute_values[length of minute_values - 1] + minute_values[0]  
        IF wrap_gap < shortest_gap THEN  
            SET shortest_gap TO wrap_gap  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN shortest_gap  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION findIntegers(n)  
        ASSIGN binaryString ← ""  
        ASSIGN tempNumber ← n  
        WHILE tempNumber > 0  
            SET binaryString ← ( (tempNumber MOD 2) AS STRING ) + binaryString  
            SET tempNumber ← tempNumber DIV 2  
        END WHILE

        SET totalLength ← LENGTH OF binaryString  
        CREATE dp ARRAY WITH SIZE totalLength + 1 FILLED WITH 0  
        SET dp[0] ← 1  
        SET dp[1] ← 2  

        SET counter ← 2  
        WHILE counter ≤ totalLength  
            SET dp[counter] ← dp[counter - 1] + dp[counter - 2]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        SET accumulatedResult ← 0  
        SET lastBit ← 0  
        SET position ← 0  

        WHILE position < totalLength  
            SWITCH binaryString[position]  
                CASE '1':  
                    SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult + dp[totalLength - position - 1]  
                    IF lastBit = 1 THEN  
                        SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult - 1  
                        BREAK OUT OF LOOP  
                    END IF  
                    SET lastBit ← 1  
                DEFAULT:  
                    SET lastBit ← 0  
            END SWITCH  
            SET position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulatedResult + 1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION kInversePairs(n, k)
        ASSIGN 1000000007 TO MOD
        ASSIGN LIST containing (k + 1) zeros TO dp_row_template
        ASSIGN LIST containing (n + 1) copies of dp_row_template TO dp
        ASSIGN 1 TO dp[0][0]

        ASSIGN 1 TO outer_counter
        WHILE outer_counter <= n
            ASSIGN 0 TO cumulative_total
            ASSIGN 0 TO inner_index
            WHILE inner_index <= k
                ASSIGN cumulative_total + dp[outer_counter - 1][inner_index] TO cumulative_total
                IF cumulative_total >= MOD THEN
                    ASSIGN cumulative_total - MOD TO cumulative_total
                END IF
                IF inner_index >= outer_counter THEN
                    ASSIGN cumulative_total - dp[outer_counter - 1][inner_index - outer_counter] + MOD TO cumulative_total
                    IF cumulative_total >= MOD THEN
                        ASSIGN cumulative_total - MOD TO cumulative_total
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN cumulative_total TO dp[outer_counter][inner_index]
                ADD 1 TO inner_index
            END WHILE
            ADD 1 TO outer_counter
        END WHILE
        RETURN dp[n][k]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c

                CASE EQUAL:

                CASE LESS:

            END SWITCH

    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)

        DECLARE direQueue AS an empty double-ended queue

        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN LENGTH of senate  
            DECLARE partyChar AS senate[counter]  
            IF NOT (partyChar NOT EQUAL TO 'R')

            ELSE

            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM direQueue AND ASSIGN TO direPos  

            IF radiantPos - direPos < 0 THEN  
                APPEND radiantPos + radiantLen TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND direPos + radiantLen TO direQueue  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  

        IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY IS FALSE THEN  
            RETURN "Radiant"  
        END IF  
        RETURN "Dire"  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION repeatedStringMatch(a string, b string) RETURNS integer  
        DECLARE minReps INTEGER  
        ASSIGN minReps TO CEILING(LENGTH(b) / LENGTH(a))  
        
        DECLARE candidate STRING  
        ASSIGN candidate TO a  
        DECLARE repeatedCandidate STRING  
        
        ASSIGN repeatedCandidate TO CONCATENATE(candidate REPEATED minReps TIMES)  
        IF CONTAINS(repeatedCandidate, b) THEN  
            RETURN minReps  
        END IF  
        
        ASSIGN repeatedCandidate TO CONCATENATE(candidate REPEATED (minReps + 1) TIMES)  
        IF CONTAINS(repeatedCandidate, b) THEN  
            RETURN (minReps + 1)  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        INITIALIZE filteredStart AS empty list  
        INITIALIZE posCounter TO 0  
        WHILE posCounter < LENGTH(start parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT posCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE filteredEnd AS empty list  
        ASSIGN idxCursor TO 0  
        WHILE idxCursor < LENGTH(end parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN ch TO end parameter[idxCursor]  
            IF ch <> 'X' THEN  
                SET filteredEnd TO filteredEnd + [(ch, idxCursor)]  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN idxCursor TO idxCursor + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF LENGTH(filteredStart) != LENGTH(filteredEnd) THEN  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO  
            ASSIGN firstTuple TO filteredStart[pairIndex]  
            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]  

            IF NOT (charA = charB) THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  

            IF charA = 'L' THEN  
                IF posA < posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean
        LOOP_WHILE (tx IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sx) AND (ty IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sy)
            IF (NOT (tx IS_DIFFERS_FROM sx)) AND (NOT (ty IS_DIFFERS_FROM sy))
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx
                    LET divisor = ty
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO tx
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN sx
                    LET dividend = ty
                    LET divisor = tx
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO ty
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            END IF
        END LOOP_WHILE
        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        ASSIGN size TO LENGTH(graph)  
        ASSIGN paint TO ARRAY OF size ELEMENTS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(vertex, shade)  
            paint[vertex] = shade  
            SET index TO 0  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[vertex])  
                ASSIGN adj TO graph[vertex][index]  
                IF paint[adj] == shade THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF paint[adj] == 0 THEN  
                    IF dfs(adj, -shade) == False THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                index = index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter < size  
            IF paint[counter] == 0 THEN  
                IF dfs(counter, 1) == False THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)
        CASE
            WHEN n <= 4800 THEN
                SET n AS (n + 24) DIV 25
            ELSE
                RETURN 1.0
        END CASE

        SET cache AS empty dictionary

        FUNCTION dp(a, b)
            DEPLOY
                VARIABLE key AS (a, b)
            RETRIEVE
                IF key IN cache THEN
                    RETURN cache[key]
                END IF
            STOP

            IF a <= 0 THEN
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.5
                ELSE
                    RETURN 1.0
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.0
                END IF
            END IF

            VARIABLE p1 AS dp(a - 4, b)
            VARIABLE p2 AS dp(a - 3, b - 1)
            VARIABLE p3 AS dp(a - 2, b - 2)
            VARIABLE p4 AS dp(a - 1, b - 3)

            VARIABLE prob AS 0.25 * (p1 + p2 + p3 + p4)
            SET cache[key] AS prob

            RETURN prob
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(n, n)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)  
        IF n GREATER THAN four thousand eight hundred THEN  
            RETURN one point zero  
        END IF  
        SET n TO n PLUS twenty four DIVIDED BY twenty five  
        SET memo TO empty dictionary  
        FUNCTION dp(a, b)  
            IF tuple of a AND b EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN value of tuple of a AND b IN memo  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point five  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN one point zero  
            END IF  
            IF b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point zero  
            END IF  
            SET prob TO zero point two five MULTIPLIED BY sum of dp of a MINUS four AND b PLUS dp of a MINUS three AND b MINUS one PLUS dp of a MINUS two AND b MINUS two PLUS dp of a MINUS one AND b MINUS three  
            SET value of tuple of a AND b IN memo TO prob  
            RETURN prob  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dp of n AND n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF source EQUALS target  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  

        SET stop_to_buses TO an empty mapping from keys to empty lists  
        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes  
            FOR each stop IN route  
                APPEND bus_index TO the list corresponding to stop IN stop_to_buses  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET visited_buses TO an empty set  
        SET visited_stops TO an empty set  

        FOR each bus IN the list of buses at the source stop FROM stop_to_buses  
            APPEND the tuple consisting of bus AND one TO bus_queue  
            ADD bus TO visited_buses  
            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR  

        WHILE bus_queue is not empty  
            REMOVE the first element FROM bus_queue AND ASSIGN the elements TO current_bus AND bus_count  

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes  
                IF stop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN bus_count  
                END IF  

                IF stop NOT IN visited_stops  
                    ADD stop TO visited_stops  
                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses

                            ADD next_bus TO visited_buses  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of next_bus AND bus_count PLUS one TO bus_queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET repeating TO empty set  
        DEFINE index AS 0  
        WHILE index LESS THAN the LENGTH OF fronts  
            SET front_val TO fronts[index]  
            SET back_val TO backs[index]  
            IF front_val EQUAL back_val THEN  
                ADD front_val TO repeating  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET combined_values TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN fronts DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR

        END FOR

        FOR EACH val IN combined_values DO  
            IF NOT (val IN repeating) THEN  
                ADD val TO candidates  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        IF LENGTH OF candidates IS NOT EQUAL TO 0 THEN  
            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        ASSIGN MODULO_CONST ← (10 ^ 9) + 7  
        SORT arr BY ascending order  
        
        INITIALIZE factorsCount AS empty mapping  
        FOR each element IN arr DO  
            SET factorsCount[element] ← 1  
        END FOR  
        
        SET outerIdx ← 0  
        WHILE outerIdx < LENGTH(arr) DO  
            SET currentVal ← arr[outerIdx]  
            SET innerIdx ← 0  
            WHILE innerIdx < outerIdx DO  
                SET divisorCandidate ← arr[innerIdx]  
                IF (currentVal − (currentVal DIV divisorCandidate) * divisorCandidate) = 0 THEN  
                    SET pairedFactor ← currentVal DIV divisorCandidate  
                    IF pairedFactor IN factorsCount THEN  
                        SET product ← factorsCount[divisorCandidate] * factorsCount[pairedFactor]  
                        SET factorsCount[currentVal] ← (factorsCount[currentVal] + product) MODULO MODULO_CONST  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN accumulation ← 0  
        FOR each countValue IN factorsCount DO  
            SET accumulation ← accumulation + countValue  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN accumulation MODULO MODULO_CONST  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            END WHILE

                    END FOR
                    INCREMENT stepCounter BY one
                END WHILE
                SET distance AS distance + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN zero
        END IF

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET vectors AS the collection of pairs [(1,0), (-1,0), (0,1), (0,-1)]  
        SET height AS LENGTH OF grid  
        SET width AS LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX zero  
        SET origin WITH NO INITIAL VALUE  
        SET total_keys AS 0  
        SET row_idx AS 0  
        WHILE row_idx < height  
            SET col_idx AS 0  
            WHILE col_idx < width  
                IF grid AT row_idx AND col_idx IS '@' THEN  
                    SET origin TO (row_idx, col_idx)  
                ELSE IF 'a' <= grid AT row_idx AND col_idx AND grid AT row_idx AND col_idx <= 'z' THEN  
                    SET total_keys TO total_keys + 1  
                END IF  
                SET col_idx TO col_idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET row_idx TO row_idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET frontier AS A new deque INITIALIZED WITH [(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0, 0)]  
        SET encountered AS A set WITH {(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0)}  
        
        WHILE NOT EMPTY frontier  
            SET curr_x, curr_y, acquired_keys, step_count TO POP LEFT frontier  
            FOR EACH vector_x, vector_y IN vectors  
                SET next_x TO curr_x + vector_x  
                SET next_y TO curr_y + vector_y  
                
                IF 0 <= next_x AND next_x < height AND 0 <= next_y AND next_y < width THEN  
                    SET cell_value TO grid AT next_x AND next_y  
                    IF cell_value = '#' THEN  
                        CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'A' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'Z' THEN  
                        SET lock_bit TO 1 << (ORD(LOWERCASE cell_value) - ORD('a'))  
                        IF (acquired_keys & lock_bit) = 0 THEN  
                            CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'a' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'z' THEN  
                        SET updated_keys TO (acquired_keys | 1 << (ORD cell_value - ORD 'a'))  
                        IF updated_keys = (1 << total_keys) - 1 THEN  
                            RETURN step_count + 1  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET updated_keys TO acquired_keys  
                    END IF  
                    
                    IF (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) NOT IN encountered THEN  
                        ADD (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) TO encountered  
                        APPEND (next_x, next_y, updated_keys, step_count + 1) TO frontier  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION movesToStamp(stamp string, target string) RETURNS list of integers  
        DEFINE totalStampLen AS LENGTH(stamp)  
        DEFINE totalTargetLen AS LENGTH(target)  
        DEFINE incomingEdges AS ARRAY OF SIZE (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1) FILLED WITH totalStampLen  
        DEFINE processingQueue AS NEW double ended queue (empty)  
        DEFINE adjacencyList AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen EACH CONTAINING EMPTY LIST  

        DEFINE outerIndex AS 0  
        WHILE outerIndex LESS THAN (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1)  
            DEFINE innerIndex AS 0  
            REPEAT  
                IF innerIndex EQUALS totalStampLen THEN  
                    BREAK  
                END IF  
                DEFINE currentStampChar AS stamp[innerIndex]  
                IF target[outerIndex + innerIndex] EQUALS currentStampChar THEN  
                    incomingEdges[outerIndex] ← incomingEdges[outerIndex] - 1  
                    IF incomingEdges[outerIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                        processingQueue.APPEND(outerIndex)  
                    END IF  
                ELSE  
                    adjacencyList[outerIndex + innerIndex].APPEND(outerIndex)  
                END IF  
                SET innerIndex TO innerIndex + 1  
            END REPEAT  
            SET outerIndex TO outerIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        DEFINE result AS EMPTY LIST  
        DEFINE visited AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen FILLED WITH False  

        FUNCTION processQueue() RETURNS VOID  
            IF processingQueue.IS_EMPTY() THEN RETURN END IF  
            DEFINE currentIndex AS processingQueue.POP_LEFT()  
            result.APPEND(currentIndex)  
            DEFINE idx AS 0  
            WHILE idx LESS THAN totalStampLen  
                DEFINE pos AS currentIndex + idx  
                IF visited[pos] EQUALS False THEN  
                    visited[pos] ← True  
                    FOR EACH sourceIndex IN adjacencyList[pos]  
                        incomingEdges[sourceIndex] ← incomingEdges[sourceIndex] - 1  
                        IF incomingEdges[sourceIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                            processingQueue.APPEND(sourceIndex)  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
                SET idx TO idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            processQueue()  
        END FUNCTION  

        processQueue()  

        FOR marker IN visited  
            IF marker EQUALS False THEN  
                RETURN EMPTY LIST  
            END IF  
        END FOR

        RETURN REVERSE(result)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION movesToStamp(stamp string, target string) RETURNS list of integers

        SET n TO the LENGTH OF target

        SET q TO an empty double ended queue

        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS m

                    DECREMENT element at position i of indeg BY one

            END IF

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION minDifficulty(jobDifficulty, d)
        LET n BE LENGTH(jobDifficulty)

            OUTPUT -1
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF
        
        FUNCTION dp(i, d)
            IF d = 1 THEN
                LET max_val BE jobDifficulty[i]
                LET idx BE i + 1
                WHILE idx < n DO
                    IF jobDifficulty[idx] > max_val THEN
                        max_val ← jobDifficulty[idx]

                    idx ← idx + 1

                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF
            
            LET lowest_difficulty BE +∞

                IF running_maximum < jobDifficulty[position] THEN
                    running_maximum ← jobDifficulty[position]
                END IF
                
                LET temp_result BE running_maximum + dp(position + 1, d - 1)
                IF temp_result < lowest_difficulty THEN
                    lowest_difficulty ← temp_result
                END IF
                position ← position + 1
            END WHILE
            
            OUTPUT lowest_difficulty
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END FUNCTION
        
        OUTPUT dp(0, d)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

        SET length2 AS LENGTH OF nums2

                SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice1

                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE

        END WHILE

            WHILE maskIndex < (2 ^ lengthB)

                    dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_OR (1 << innerIndex)] ←

                            dp[outerIndex][maskIndex] + cost[outerIndex][innerIndex]
                        )
                    innerIndex ← innerIndex + 1
                END WHILE

                SET checkIndex TO 0
                WHILE checkIndex < lengthB
                    IF (maskIndex BITWISE_AND (1 << checkIndex)) ≠ 0 THEN
                        dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex] ←
                            MINIMUM(
                                dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex],
                                dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_XOR (1 << checkIndex)] + cost[outerIndex][checkIndex]
                            )
                    ENDIF
                    checkIndex ← checkIndex + 1
                END WHILE

                maskIndex ← maskIndex + 1
            END WHILE
            outerIndex ← outerIndex + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN dp[lengthA][(2 ^ lengthB) - 1]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION solve(nums list OF integers, queries list OF list OF integers) RETURNS list OF integers  
        SET MODULO_VALUE AS 10^9 + 7  
        SET length_nums AS LENGTH OF nums  
        SET highest_y_value AS MAXIMUM OF (EXTRACT second ELEMENT FROM EACH pair IN queries)  
        SET prefix_accumulators AS LIST OF (highest_y_value + 1) ITEMS EACH INITIALIZED TO A LIST OF length_nums TIMES 0  
        
        SET current_y TO 1  
        WHILE current_y <= highest_y_value  
            SET index_i TO length_nums - 1  
            WHILE index_i >= 0  
                IF (index_i + current_y) < length_nums THEN  
                    LET temp_sum BE nums[index_i] + prefix_accumulators[current_y][index_i + current_y]  
                    SET prefix_accumulators[current_y][index_i] AS temp_sum  
                ELSE  
                    SET prefix_accumulators[current_y][index_i] AS nums[index_i]  
                END IF  
                SET index_i TO index_i - 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET current_y TO current_y + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET results AS EMPTY LIST  
        FOR EACH query_pair IN queries  
            LET x_val BE query_pair[0]  
            LET y_val BE query_pair[1]  
            LET remainder_value BE prefix_accumulators[y_val][x_val] MODULO MODULO_VALUE  
            APPEND remainder_value TO results  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN results  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            SET sum_total AS sum_total PLUS element at position iterator_index of nums  
            SET iterator_index AS iterator_index PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET length_nums AS length of nums

        CREATE diff_counts_right AS a dictionary defaulting to 0

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION minimumFinishTime(tires, changeTime, numLaps)
        LET minimal_times BE an array of length 15 WHERE each element IS assigned +∞
        FOR EACH (initial_value, multiplier) IN tires DO
            LET accumulated_time BE 0
            LET lap_counter BE 0
            WHILE lap_counter < 15 DO
                LET current_lap_duration BE initial_value * (multiplier ^ lap_counter)
                IF NOT (current_lap_duration ≤ changeTime + initial_value) THEN
                    EXIT WHILE
                END IF
                accumulated_time ← accumulated_time + current_lap_duration
                IF accumulated_time < minimal_times[lap_counter] THEN
                    minimal_times[lap_counter] ← accumulated_time
                END IF
                lap_counter ← lap_counter + 1
            END WHILE
        END FOR

        LET dp_table BE a list of size (numLaps + 1) FILLED WITH +∞
        SET dp_table[0] TO 0

        LET outer_index BE 1
        WHILE outer_index ≤ numLaps DO
            LET inner_index BE 0
            WHILE inner_index ≤ MIN(outer_index - 1, 14) DO
                LET proposed_time BE dp_table[outer_index - inner_index - 1] + minimal_times[inner_index] + changeTime
                IF proposed_time < dp_table[outer_index] THEN
                    dp_table[outer_index] ← proposed_time
                END IF
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1
            END WHILE
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN dp_table[numLaps] - changeTime
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            SET sum_items TO 0
            SET total_value TO 0

                INCREMENT offer_index BY 1

            RETURN minimal_cost

        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dfs(the tuple version of needs)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean
        IF LENGTH sentence1 == LENGTH sentence2 THEN
        ELSE
            RETURN false
        END IF

        DECLARE registry AS dictionary = {}

        FUNCTION find(element element TO element) RETURNS element
            DECLARE stack AS list = []
            DECLARE current AS element = element
            WHILE current != registry[current] DO
                PUSH current INTO stack
                SET current = registry[current]
            END WHILE
            FOR each node IN stack DO
                SET registry[node] = current
            END FOR
            RETURN current
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION union(first first TO first second second TO second)
            DECLARE rootFirst AS first = find(first)
            DECLARE rootSecond AS second = find(second)
            IF rootFirst != rootSecond THEN
                SET registry[rootSecond] = rootFirst
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        DECLARE index1 AS int = 0
        WHILE index1 < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE couple AS list = similarPairs[index1]
            DECLARE idxWord AS int = 0
            WHILE idxWord < LENGTH couple DO
                DECLARE token AS string = couple[idxWord]
                IF NOT token IN registry THEN
                    SET registry[token] = token
                END IF
                SET idxWord = idxWord + 1
            END WHILE
            SET index1 = index1 + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE idxPair AS int = 0
        WHILE idxPair < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE a AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][0]
            DECLARE b AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][1]
            CALL union(a b)
            SET idxPair = idxPair + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE pos AS int = 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH sentence1 DO
            DECLARE firstWord AS string = sentence1[pos]
            DECLARE secondWord AS string = sentence2[pos]
            IF NOT firstWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[firstWord] = firstWord
            END IF
            IF NOT secondWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[secondWord] = secondWord
            END IF

            IF find(firstWord) != find(secondWord) THEN
                RETURN false
            END IF
            SET pos = pos + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN true
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean  
        IF the LENGTH OF sentence1 NOT EQUALS the LENGTH OF sentence2  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        SET parent TO empty dictionary  

        FUNCTION find(x x TO x) RETURNS x  
            IF element at position x of parent NOT EQUALS x  
                SET element at position x of parent TO find(element at position x of parent)  
            END IF  
            RETURN element at position x of parent  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION union(x x TO x y y TO y)  
            SET rootX TO find(x)  
            SET rootY TO find(y)  
            IF rootX NOT EQUALS rootY  
                SET element at position rootY of parent TO rootX  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR each pair IN similarPairs  
            FOR each word IN pair  
                IF word NOT IN parent  
                    SET element at position word of parent TO word  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        FOR each x y IN similarPairs  
            union(x y)  
        END FOR  

        FOR each w1 w2 IN sentence1 sentence2  
            IF w1 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w1 of parent TO w1  
            END IF  
            IF w2 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w2 of parent TO w2  
            END IF  
            IF find(w1) NOT EQUALS find(w2)  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)
            IF age_y <= (age_x / 2 + 7) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF age_y > age_x THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF (age_y > 100) AND (age_x < 100) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE
                RETURN true
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        SET tally TO dictionary()
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(ages)
            IF ages[idx] IN tally THEN
                tally[ages[idx]] = tally[ages[idx]] + 1
            ELSE
                tally[ages[idx]] = 1
            END IF
            idx = idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET accumulated TO 0
        SET p_age_x TO 1
        WHILE p_age_x <= 120
            SET p_age_y TO 1
            WHILE p_age_y <= 120
                IF request_will_be_sent(p_age_x, p_age_y) THEN
                    IF p_age_x = p_age_y THEN
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * (tally.get(p_age_y, 0) - 1))
                    ELSE
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * tally.get(p_age_y, 0))
                    END IF
                END IF
                p_age_y = p_age_y + 1
            END WHILE
            p_age_x = p_age_x + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulated
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)  
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
            RETURN NOT (age_y IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO age_x MULTIPLIED BY one half PLUS seven OR age_y IS GREATER THAN age_x OR age_y IS GREATER THAN one hundred AND age_x IS LESS THAN one hundred)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET count TO list of zero repeated one hundred and twenty one times  
        FOR each age IN ages  
            INCREMENT element at position age of count BY one  
        END FOR  

        SET total_requests TO zero  
        FOR age_x FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
            FOR age_y FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
                IF request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
                    INCREMENT total_requests BY element at position age_x of count MULTIPLIED BY element at position age_y of count MINUS one IF age_x EQUALS age_y ELSE element at position age_y of count  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN total_requests  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF NOT (0 <= x AND x < LENGTH of grid AND 0 <= y AND y < LENGTH of grid at 0) OR grid at x, y EQUALS 0 THEN  
                EXIT FUNCTION  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN 0 TO grid at x, y  
            INSERT (x, y) INTO island  
            CALL dfs(x + 1, y, island)  
            CALL dfs(x - 1, y, island)  
            CALL dfs(x, y + 1, island)  
            CALL dfs(x, y - 1, island)  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            ASSIGN empty array TO shapes  
            DEFINE transforms AS [(1, 1), (1, -1), (-1, 1), (-1, -1)]  
            SET idx TO 0  
            WHILE idx < LENGTH of transforms DO  
                ASSIGN empty array TO temp_island  
                LET dx, dy BE transforms at idx  
                LET v TO 0  
                WHILE v < LENGTH of island DO  
                    LET px, py BE island at v  
                    INSERT (px * dx, py * dy) INTO temp_island  
                    INCREMENT v BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                SORT temp_island by ascending order  
                LET min_x BE temp_island at 0, 0  
                LET min_y BE temp_island at 0, 1  
                LET k BE 1  
                WHILE k < LENGTH of temp_island DO  
                    IF temp_island at k, 0 < min_x THEN  
                        ASSIGN temp_island at k, 0 TO min_x  
                    END IF  
                    IF temp_island at k, 1 < min_y THEN  
                        ASSIGN temp_island at k, 1 TO min_y  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT k BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                LET normalized_shape BE empty list  
                LET m TO 0  
                WHILE m < LENGTH of temp_island DO  
                    LET cx, cy BE temp_island at m  
                    INSERT (cx - min_x, cy - min_y) INTO normalized_shape  
                    INCREMENT m BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                INSERT TUPLE OF normalized_shape INTO shapes  
                INCREMENT idx BY 1  
            END WHILE  

            LET original_cnt BE LENGTH of shapes  
            LET r TO 0  
            WHILE r < original_cnt DO  
                LET shape BE shapes at r  
                LET rotated_shape BE empty list  
                LET s TO 0  
                WHILE s < LENGTH of shape DO  
                    LET ox, oy BE shape at s  
                    INSERT (oy, -ox) INTO rotated_shape  
                    INCREMENT s BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                INSERT TUPLE OF rotated_shape INTO shapes  
                INCREMENT r BY 1  
            END WHILE  

            RETURN MINIMUM element IN shapes by lex order  
        END FUNCTION  

        ASSIGN empty set TO islands  
        LET i_iter BE 0  
        WHILE i_iter < LENGTH of grid DO  
            LET j_iter BE 0  
            WHILE j_iter < LENGTH of grid at 0 DO  
                IF grid at i_iter, j_iter EQUALS 1 THEN  
                    ASSIGN empty array TO island  
                    CALL dfs(i_iter, j_iter, island)  
                    ADD normalize(island) TO islands  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT j_iter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT i_iter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN LENGTH of islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF x LESS THAN zero OR x GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH OF grid OR y LESS THAN zero OR y GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid OR element at position x of grid at position y EQUALS zero  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            SET element at position x of grid at position y TO zero  
            APPEND tuple of x and y TO island  
            CALL dfs WITH x PLUS one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x MINUS one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y PLUS one AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y MINUS one AND island  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            SET shapes TO empty list  
            FOR each pair dx and dy IN list of pairs of one and one PLUS one and minus one PLUS minus one and one PLUS minus one and minus one  
                SET new_island TO empty list  
                FOR each pair x and y IN island  
                    APPEND tuple of x MULTIPLIED BY dx AND y MULTIPLIED BY dy TO new_island  
                END FOR  
                SORT new_island in ascending order  
                SET min_x TO the minimum x among all pairs in new_island  
                SET min_y TO the minimum y among all pairs in new_island  
                APPEND tuple of pairs where each x MINUS min_x AND each y MINUS min_y from new_island TO shapes  
            END FOR  
            SET original_length TO LENGTH OF shapes  
            FOR index FROM zero TO original_length MINUS one  
                APPEND tuple of pairs where y AND negative x from shape at position index TO shapes  
            END FOR  
            RETURN the minimal element in shapes according to lexicographical order  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET islands TO empty set  
        FOR i FROM zero TO LENGTH OF grid MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid at position j EQUALS one  
                    SET island TO empty list  
                    CALL dfs WITH i AND j AND island  
                    ADD normalize of island TO islands  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN LENGTH OF islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
  FUNCTION findReplaceString(s parameter, indices parameter, sources parameter, targets parameter)
    SET combined TO empty queue
    FOR counter FROM 0 TO LENGTH OF indices parameter MINUS 1 DO
      ENQUEUE TO combined THE tuple (indices parameter[counter], sources parameter[counter], targets parameter[counter])
    END FOR
    CONVERT combined TO list AND SORT BY first element OF each tuple ASCENDING
    
    SET output TO empty list
    SET last_pos TO 0
    
    FOR EACH element IN combined DO
      DESTRUCTURE element INTO start_pos, src_str, tgt_str
      
      IF last_pos >= start_pos THEN
        CONTINUE TO NEXT iteration
      END IF
      
      APPEND substring OF s parameter FROM last_pos TO start_pos MINUS 1 TO output
      
      SET expected_segment TO substring OF s parameter FROM start_pos TO start_pos PLUS LENGTH OF src_str MINUS 1
      
      IF expected_segment NOT EQUAL TO src_str THEN
        APPEND expected_segment TO output
      ELSE
        APPEND tgt_str TO output
      END IF
      
      SET last_pos TO start_pos PLUS LENGTH OF src_str
    END FOR
    
    APPEND substring OF s parameter FROM last_pos TO END TO output
    
    SET final_string TO empty string
    FOR EACH piece IN output DO
      final_string = final_string + piece
    END FOR
    
    RETURN final_string
  END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION findReplaceString(s parameter, indices parameter, sources parameter, targets parameter)  
        SET replacements TO list of tuples made of element at same position of indices parameter AND sources parameter AND targets parameter sorted by the first element of each tuple  
        SET result TO empty list  
        SET prev_end TO zero  
        FOR each tuple composed of index variable AND source variable AND target variable IN replacements  
            APPEND substring of s parameter from position prev_end TO position index MINUS one to result  
            IF substring of s parameter from position index TO position index PLUS the LENGTH OF source variable MINUS one EQUALS source variable  
                APPEND target variable TO result  
            ELSE  
                APPEND substring of s parameter from position index TO position index PLUS the LENGTH OF source variable MINUS one TO result  
            END IF  
            SET prev_end TO index PLUS the LENGTH OF source variable  
        END FOR  
        APPEND substring of s parameter from position prev_end TO the end TO result  
        RETURN concatenation of all elements IN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
